Change: Compared SS to TINSS and VPA; Estimated q;  Additional uncertainty in acoustic-survey selectivity; Additional uncertainty in M of older-fish
Included uncertainty in $\\sigma_R$; Increased allowable flexibility in time-varying fishery selectivity; Cohort-specific ageing error; California 1960s length-frequency distributions
Increased compatibility of SS and TINSS, except for age-composition likelihood
One framework for base model; TINSS changed to CCAM
Re-analyzed 1998-2015 acoustic-survey data; Removed 1995 survey data
Added 1995 survey data; Increased allowable selectivity variation to 0.20
Used D-M to weight age compositions; Updated maturity and fecundity; Stopped transforming selectivity parameters
Normal prior for D-M parameters; remove sum to zero constraint for recruitment deviations
Turn off estimation of late and forecast recruitment deviations; exclude relative age-1 index
